output: Major League Cricket is owned by a variety of investors including high-profile individuals and venture groups such as Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, Adobe CEO Shantanu Narayen, Madrona Venture Group, Google executives, and Iconic Ventures. The league has received substantial financial backing, with around $850 million invested in establishing a viable professional cricket league in the US. Each of the six teams in the league is expected to spend between $75 million and $100 million over the coming year to support their operations and growth.

This year's edition of the MLC has several notable differences compared to the previous year. Firstly, the number of matches has increased from 19 to 25, indicating an expansion of the tournament. Additionally, the MLC has been granted List A status by the ICC, which enhances its credibility and allows player performances to be officially recognized in career statistics. The tournament also plans to grow further, with an aim to increase to a 34-game season by 2025. Furthermore, the format includes an extra six league matches and a four-game playoff series, providing more competitive opportunities for the teams involved.
In the tournament, a total of 311 sixes were scored by the batsmen. The team that scored the most sixes was SFU, with a total of 79 sixes.
Three batsmen scored centuries. Their names are Faf Du Plessis, F Allen, and R Rickelton, each scoring one century.
The teams that won matches played at Church Street Park ground are Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom.
